oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1958-02-01 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from February 1, 1958. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Cowboy Copas (host/performer), guest performer Jimmy C. Newman (although Rusty & Doug were advertised as the guests for this week on the previous show), and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 956th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Minnie Pearl; Jimmy C. Newman; Stringbean; Cowboy Copas
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Cowboy Copas introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) -- Prince Albert commercial (Minnie Pearl, Cowboy Copas) -- Prince Albert jingle -- Cowboy Copas introduces Jimmy Newman -- You're The Idol Of My Dreams (Jimmy C. Newman) -- Cowboy Copas introduces Stringbean -- Goodbye Liza Jane (Stringbean) -- Cowboy Copas talks -- You Don't Have To Be A Baby To Cry (Cowboy Copas) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Cowboy Copas) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Station announcements (Grant Turner)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Brasfield, Rod; Minnie Pearl; Atkins, Chet; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Jackson, Tommy; Copas, Cowboy; Newman, Jimmy C.
